This introduction is not part of IEEE Std 1522-2004.
IEEE Trial-Use Standard for Testability and Diagnosability Characteristics and Metrics is not part of this introduction.
Systems became more complex costly and difficult to diagnose and repair.
Initiatives were started to address these problems.
The objective of one initiative was to make systems easier to test.
This commercial standard must provide specific unambiguous definitions of criteria for assessing system testability.
IEEE has started initiatives to standardize test architectures.

The IEEE 1232TM Artificial Intelligence Exchange and Service Tie to All Test Environments series of standards provide the foundation for precise and unambiguous testability and diagnosability metrics.

The IEEE 1232TM Artificial Intelligence Exchange and Service Tie to All Test Environments series of standards provide the foundation for precise and unambiguous testability and diagnosability metrics.
It is the objective of this standard to provide notionally correct and inherently useful but mathematically precise definitions of testability measures.
Notionally correct means that the measures are not in conflict with intuitive and historical representations.

A repair is defined by the information model to be the process undertaken to return the unit to service.
The function repair_set returns the set of all repairs within a diagnostic model at a particular level.
A resource is defined within the information model to be something that any given action in the maintenance process is likely to require to perform that action.
The function resource_set returns the set of all resources within a diagnostic model at a particular level.
The function resource_set returns the set of all resources within a diagnostic model at a particular level.
All fundamental measures are based on the AI-ESTATE common element model.
Costs are measurable quantities of time or resources.
Costs include money and/or expendables.
Cost is computed over a set of tests or repairs by using associated test action costs, repair action costs, and resource costs.
All cost calculations use the same units of measure and are based on resource cost.
No unit conversion is included in the definition.

The repair_level_time_cost adds time cost of actions.
The repair_level_time_cost is limited to resources and actions available at a particular level of indenture.
The repair_level_time_cost computes repair cost given the specified level.
The function repair_level_time_cost takes three parameters.
The function repair_level_time_cost returns a real value.
The repair_non_time_cost adds non-time cost of actions.
The repair_non_time_cost is limited to resources and actions available in the required context at a particular level of indenture.
The repair_non_time_cost computes repair cost given both the specified context and the specified level.
The function repair_non_time_cost takes four parameters.
The function repair_non_time_cost returns a real value.
The repair_time_cost adds time cost of actions.
The repair_time_cost is limited to resources and actions available in the required context at a particular level of indenture.
The repair_time_cost computes repair cost given both the specified context and the specified level.
The function repair_time_cost takes four parameters.
The function repair_time_cost returns a real value.
The test_context_non_time_cost adds non-time cost of actions.
The test_context_non_time_cost is limited to resources and actions available in the required context.
The test_context_non_time_cost computes test cost given the specified context.

IEEE Std 1522-2004 is a trial-use standard.
IEEE Std 1522-2004 is for testability and function.
isolatable_diagnoses_set is a function.
isolatable_diagnoses_set takes a diagnostic model as input.
isolatable_diagnoses_set takes a level as input.
isolatable_diagnoses_set takes a group size as input.
isolatable_diagnoses_set returns a set of diagnosis ambiguity.
isolatable_diagnoses_set returns a set of diagnosis ambiguity groups of size n.
isolatable_diagnoses_set includes ambiguity with No Fault in the analysis if requested.
isolatable_failures_set is a function.
isolatable_failures_set takes a diagnostic model as input.
isolatable_failures_set takes a level as input.
isolatable_failures_set takes a group size as input.
isolatable_failures_set returns a set of diagnosis ambiguity.
isolatable_failures_set returns a set of diagnosis ambiguity groups of size n.
isolatable_failures_set includes ambiguity with No Fault in the analysis if requested.
isolatable_failures_set returns groups containing only diagnoses of type 'failure'.
isolatable_faults_set is a function.
isolatable_faults_set takes a diagnostic model as input.
isolatable_faults_set takes a level as input.
isolatable_faults_set takes a group size as input.
isolatable_faults_set returns a set of diagnosis ambiguity.
isolatable_faults_set returns a set of diagnosis ambiguity groups of size n.
isolatable_faults_set includes ambiguity with No Fault in the analysis if requested.
isolatable_faults_set returns groups containing only diagnoses of type 'fault'.
isolatable_faults_set is a function.
isolatable_faults_set takes a diagnostic model as input.
isolatable_faults_set takes a level as input.
isolatable_faults_set takes a group size as input.
isolatable_faults_set returns a set of diagnosis ambiguity.
isolatable_faults_set returns a set of diagnosis ambiguity groups of size n.
isolatable_faults_set includes ambiguity with No Fault in the analysis if requested.
isolatable_faults_set returns groups containing only diagnoses of type 'fault' for which constituent faults are associated with exactly n repair items.
n is the total number of repair item ambiguity groups for the lvl and mdl
The delta function returns zero if the repair time for an ambiguity group is less than the specified goal of 60 minutes
An alternative version of this metric could penalize for exceeding the goal by too much
This subclause is informative only and is not a normative part of this standard
Projected effect of ambiguity on false removals (PEAFR) is a measure of the effect that ambiguous isolation has on the frequency of false removals
PEAFR is described by Equation (10)
AGi is the ith repair item ambiguity group
P(AGi) is the probability of repair item set (AGi)
mdl is the diagnostic model for which this metric is to be calculated
lvl is the level of the diagnostic model at which faults are to be counted
n is the total number of repair item ambiguity groups for the lvl and mdl
PEAFR gives the worst-case percentage of false removals because of diagnostic ambiguity for the specified level of the given diagnostic model
PEAFR projects the relative likelihood of false removals when malfunctions occur
The likelihood of false removals is calculated using the formula P(AGi) / (|AGi| * RT(AGi))
The formula is summed over all repair item ambiguity groups
The product life cycle process is related to diagnostic analysis and design.
A comprehensive diagnostic analysis and design program requires a dedicated effort.
The diagnostic design life cycle is organized around five phases.
The five phases are: Requirements definition, Architecture design, Detailed test design, Verification and validation, and Diagnostic maturation.
A brief description of each phase is provided in B.1â€“B.7.
The first step in an effective testability program is to define a complete set of requirements.
Diagnostic requirements are typically expressed in performance terms.
Diagnostic requirements should express the desired outcome without directing how to achieve it.
Goals are typically specified around fault detection, fault isolation, and fault isolation resolution or operational isolation.
Mission reliability is a related requirement examined early in the design phase.
Mission reliability is used to verify the reliability of systems that can be reconfigured, redundant, or safety-critical.
Mission reliability is being applied as a measure of prognostic capability to satisfy mission requirements with a satisfactory measure of confidence.
System prognostics are shown analytically to be capable of predicting some interval over which the system will operate without malfunction.
System-level metrics may be specified at this time, including mean time between failure and operational availability.
Derivative requirements include mean time to repair, maintenance frequency, and skill levels of repair personnel.
Customer warranties may be executed on some metrics such as mean time between failure or operational availability.
IEEE Std 1522-2004 is a standard.
The standard is copyrighted by IEEE.
The standard is from 2004.
The standard has annex C.
Annex C is normative.
Annex C contains extensions to the AI-ESTATE standard.
The AI-ESTATE standard is required by the probability_of_diagnosis and probability_of_repair_item_set measures.
The AI-ESTATE standard is defined within IEEE Std 1232-2002.
The AI-ESTATE standard allows a failure rate value to be assigned to each diagnosis.
The AI-ESTATE standard is extended in annex C.
The extension redefines the diagnosis entity in the common element model.
The common element model is defined within IEEE Std 1232-2002.
The AI-ESTATE common element model is used in the extension.
The extension is for the failure rate entity.
The failure rate entity is a subtype of the failure_rate entity.
The failure_rate entity is in the AI-ESTATE common element model.
The failure_rate entity has a frequency value.
The failure_rate entity has two subtypes: EXTEND_weibull_failure_rate and EXTEND_exponential_failure_rate.
EXTEND_failure_rate is an abstract entity.
EXTEND_failure_rate is a subtype of the failure_rate entity.
EXTEND_failure_rate contains the frequency value for the associated failure rate.
The failure_rate entity is a subtype of another entity.
The failure_rate entity has an associated_frequency attribute.
The associated_frequency attribute is of type frequency.
IEEE Std 1522-2004 is a trial-use standard.
The standard is for testability and diagnosis.
The standard is copyrighted by IEEE.
The standard is from 2004.
The standard has attribute definitions.
The attribute definitions include associated_frequency.
The associated_frequency attribute is used to specify the rate of failures.
The associated_frequency attribute is used to specify the rate of failures over a given time span.
The associated_frequency attribute is of type REAL.
beta is a REAL.
beta is an attribute.
alpha is an attribute.
alpha is used to specify the alpha parameter of the Weibull distribution.
beta is used to specify the beta parameter of the Weibull distribution.
EXTEND_exponential_failure_rate is a subtype of EXTEND_failure_rate.
EXTEND_exponential_failure_rate is used when the associated failure rate is the result of an exponential distribution.
EXTEND_exponential_failure_rate is a subtype of EXTEND_failure_rate.
EXTEND_exponential_failure_rate is used when the associated failure rate is the result of an exponential distribution.
EXTEND_diagnosis is a subtype of diagnosis.
EXTEND_diagnosis contains the failure rate for the associated diagnosis.
new_rate is an attribute.
new_rate is used to specify the failure rate associated with the given diagnosis.
